website_summaries.verdict: The best computer cube case with a more efficient design than most tower options.
pros: Large front vents allow more air to pull through the inside of the case than other cube cases
Inside includes cable routing and supports for liquid cooling
cons: Exterior surface leaves marks when touched

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Airflow and it looks Great
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very spacious and easy to build in. It also maintains a great flow of air through the main chamber, and the stock fans have little white lights, which are nice and basic. There is also room for a 120mm-240mm water cooler radiator on the roof, to help keep your PC cooled off if you are overclocking like I am. Also the back compartment makes it easy to keep your wires tidy, allowing for better cooling efficiency and an overall nicer look inside the case. My only problem is with the delivery, it seems that a small corner in the bottom was damaged, but it is no big deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Moore

customer_reviews.title: Gamer PC Build
customer_reviews.text: Great case and plenty of room. PROs - Space is plentiful - Air flow is abundant if you attempt any level of cable management. - Love having the MB standoffs built in. CONs - Side panels wiggle 1-2 mms when installed. The sides don't secure tightly is all. - Front Fans (2x140mms) are LED and the rear fan is not, small issue I know, but why not keep it standard??? I bought a new 140mm LED fan to replace the non-led one. Overall, great box to use when wanting to showcase your hardware.
customer_reviews.author: AFShooter

customer_reviews.title: Great basic gaming case.  Nod bad for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Like the case form and size. The window on the side is lacking. It’s the thinnest glass I have ever seen on a case. The fans are basic single color white led but not the quietest I’ve seen by any means. Swapped with attic cool fans after first boot and cut noise level in half. The side panels are extremely thin so if you want a very quiet case you may want to keep looking. Bang for the buck though, I would buy it again as it does look good.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff A.

customer_reviews.title: Missing bottom dust filter. Otherwise great.
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this case a little under a year ago. The case is big which isn’t the issue the issue I found out just today was that it never came with a bottom dust filter which explains why there has been such a large dust build up in the case over the last 8months or so. I only figured it out when I went to take it out and clean it along with my other case filters. Sucks there isn’t a way to order a new one either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cube
customer_reviews.text: Well, it's huge. But it looks cool and is really good quality. I wish it had a way to turn the fan lights off, but that's just being picky. I had three main reasons I bought this case. 1. I have a really big GPU and wanted to be sure it would fit 2. It looks cool and I'm a vain and petty person 3. It needed to be stable so my cat could jump on it and not knock it over It works great on all counts. My wishlist would be 1 or 2 more USB ports on the front, and ability to turn the LEDs off. Those are pretty marginal complaints though, it's a good tower.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Great case. I would get 3x 120mm fan for ...
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Got new lights and GPU. Since it has 8 expansion slots, 4 dual slot cards can fit. I have 3x R9 Fury and it fits. -*-*-*-*-*-*-* Great case. I would get 3x 120mm fan for the front since the opening is optimal for that size instead of 140mm. The included fans are serviceable, just not the optimal type IMO. I have 2x 780 Ti classified in SLI on Maximus VI Formula. Hope that gives an estimate with the space.
customer_reviews.author: franchise

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I did a build with this case today. I've used corsair cases for my previous 3 builds and loved them, but I CANNOT recommend this to anyone. 1) No filters on top of case where you would attach an AIO. 2) Mostly made of thin sheets of metal with plastic that is not secure. 3) One of the glued on feet ALREADY fell off. 4) Front usb are loose and not completely secure.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME Case but One TINY Issue.
customer_reviews.text: I had one tiny issue but I wont let its insignificance be the difference between 4 and 5 stars. This case is AWESOME. Extremely well designed, it can fit an H110 easilly. One small problem I had was the front headphone analog port is really screwy and doesn't want to work 90% of the time. Just use the port located on your motherboard if you want to use analog headphones/headset. Its really not that big of a deal and you might not even have this problem with yours if you so chose.
customer_reviews.author: Rhett

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure you read the other reviews on how it's easy to install and how it lacks in HDD ports. It's a very sleek and great looking cube. It does what it's supposed to do and that's keep your components cool and keep the clutter out of sight. Like other buyers yes I do wish it came with a filter for the bottom of the case instead of leaving it open. I didn't break anything of mine but I did notice the plastic isn't as tough as I hoped it would be. For the price of it, the look, the cooling air that really does make a difference in temperature... it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Cell Out

customer_reviews.title: I love this case
customer_reviews.text: I love this case! It's very roomy so it's easy to do cable management. I also like the fact that it requires no tools when I needed to mount both my mechanical HD and SSD. Motherboard: Asus Sabertooth Z87 CPU: Intel Core i7 4790K CPU Cooler: Corsair H100i GTX GPU: EVGA GeForce GTX 980 FTW RAM: 16GB Corsair Dominator Platinum HD 1: 500GB Samsung 850 SSD HD 2: 1TB Western Digital Black Sound Card: Asus Xonar Essence STX Network Adapter: Asus PCE AC68 PSU: 850W EVGA SuperNova G2 Case: Corsair Carbide Air 540
customer_reviews.author: K. Paik

customer_reviews.title: Best engineered case I've seen.
customer_reviews.text: I've been building computers for decades. This case, for only $100, is fantastic. Because the power supply is on one side and the motherboard on the other, the cables are completely out of your way. Plenty of room, which makes for a cooler rig. The fans are effective and quiet. It's not that the materials are all that expensive, is just so well thought out and easy to work with. One caveat;. It is about 13" side, so be prepared.
customer_reviews.author: rabinnh

customer_reviews.title: the air flow is beyond reproach and it just looks good sitting on my desk
customer_reviews.text: It's a touch wider than I thought it would be ; that being said, the air flow is beyond reproach and it just looks good sitting on my desk. I initially bought the 240 version of this case but was forced to upgrade when my 1080 didn't quite fit. Tons of room, good cable management, and excellent air flow (did I mention the air flow?) With 5 fans (all corsair fans) and a water cooler it's so quiet it's easy to forget it's on. Corsair continues to uphold the standard of quality I've come to expect from them.
customer_reviews.author: E. L. Hanes

customer_reviews.title: Not my usual, but nice!
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this review on the PC that I purchased for this build. First let me say the build was a delight. With all the extra space provided by this case, assembly and cable management were easier than any build I've ever had. The build before this, I had a regular sized (but still Corsair, I love those guys) case, and it was a bit of a struggle to get my liquid cooling unit mounted. Not so with this gem. Additionally the case is ULTRA-quiet. Really, I couldn't be more pleased. If your desk has the real estate space for a wider than average case, I totally recommend this one. She's a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: SATA quick connect ports on the bottom of the case don't work. You may need to rip them out and run cables.
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, I love the look of this case and it matches the Asus Sabertooth Z170 and the Crucial Ballistix white camo RAM great; HOWEVER - the SATA drive ports on the bottom of the cave have that docking port where both ports don't work for me. Soon as I ripped those babies out and ran a regular SATA cable didn't have any problems. I guess its not the end of the world but also kindof a bummer since it was a new build...
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Hate cable management? Love Fresh Air? Get This Case!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It is a beautiful case that is highly "meshy" and permits a ton of air flow. Cable management is much easier because the back panel is deep enough to hide the worst cable management. The white LED fans in the front are a nice touch. CONS: The plastic trim parts are a bit flimsy and breakable. The front panel is clear acrylic and therefore more flexy than ideal. My first case was crushed like a forklift ran into it, but the RMA was easy and fast. Only 2 x 3.5" HDD bays (but 6 SDD). MidTower design is a little cramped if you are used to Full Towers, but the added width makes up for it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Kiser

customer_reviews.title: great case I highly recommend it to anyone
customer_reviews.text: great case I highly recommend it to anyone. I modded mine slightly to allow my radiator for my cpu to sit on top of the case otherwise the radiator blocks the top inside fan. I put in 3 120mm fans vs the 2 140 it comes with. the 3 120's move more air than the 2 140's. it has plenty of room in though and looks very clean without all the added wiring from the power supply and the drive. I still think there should be some sort of fan on the power supply side to pull hot air out that builds up behind there from the drives and the psu and everything else.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: You will love it
customer_reviews.text: What can i say this case is amazing. Most defiantly the easy cable management comes package nice 3 fans two with white led. Very easy to disassemble to access your parts.What i love the most is probably going to be is the second the department on the back side which let you put your power supply an all you extra wires which might be a little messy back there an your 4 2.5 hard drive bays are back there to.. I have had a lot of cases an this is by far my favorite. Is kinda big but that is my preference i love this case.
customer_reviews.author: Hublah

customer_reviews.title: Amazing case for the wire hiding impaired.
customer_reviews.text: I love this case! It looks slick, there is plenty of room and the cooling flow is perfect. The extra panel in the back for wire management is a life saver for people like me who don't have the patience for normal wire hiding. The HDD snap connectors are also really really cool. I am thoroughly impressed with this case and will not be upgrading it for a long while. Highly recommended for people who want a clean case with little work organizing wires and such.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: So much room. I've been using this case for a few months. As a long time Apple fanboy I've not built my own Windows PC in at least a decade. This case made it so easy to build again. There was more than enough room for my GTX 1080 and the Arctic water cooler. The only thing it's missing is a built in SD card slot.
customer_reviews.author: Sephethus

customer_reviews.title: This case is really awesome, unless you have pets
customer_reviews.text: This case is really awesome, unless you have pets. I have to clean it out monthly, sometimes sooner to clear all the dust that gets into this case. Stupid cat. I did like the ease of building in this case, and the look, and feel of it. Sadly without dust filters on every access point the case is just okay. The only dust filter set is about $60, and only one filter comes with the unit on the intake on the front of the case.
customer_reviews.author: Straph

customer_reviews.title: Nice case!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome case! I wanted something that split the case in half, and this was the answer. I was able to put my Hard drive, PSU, water reservoir, and watercooling pump on the right side, and the RX360 radiator is mounted on the front fans. Its exactly what I was looking for! Overall, the quality is good. You can disassemble it down to just the metal case frame very easily. I did notice issue with the plastic pieces not aligning 100%, but this isn't a top of the line case, so I couldn't be to picky. I also had to add some sound proofing foam to the Drive bay bezels because it would constantly vibrate
customer_reviews.author: Vickie

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of room to work with nice looking case
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room to work with nice looking case. However front audio port was shorted from factory. Making it unusable and a fire hazard. If i was not home when it finally gave up and fried i would have lost my whole build. Probably just one of those things quality control could have picked up. Anyone with a volt-ohm meter could have found.My mistake for trusting Corsair. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: So much space! I first came across this case ...
customer_reviews.text: So much space! I first came across this case at a local computer store, and couldn't believe how much room it had. Building a high-end gaming machine with water cooling, multiple GPUs, and tons of storage was a breeze because of how well designed it is. It's a wider profile than just about any other case on the market, but the perks you get more than make up for that.
customer_reviews.author: Landon Moses

customer_reviews.title: Cable management is a breeze as there is so much room in the back to work the cables however you like. Power supply sits in the
customer_reviews.text: Honestly didnt expect this thing to be that big but let me tell you, its BIG. Make sure you take your measurements correctly before buying this case. The side panel window is lightly tinted so just keep that in mind. Cable management is a breeze as there is so much room in the back to work the cables however you like. Power supply sits in the back also which helps with the thermals all around. You can fit basically anything you want in this box. Front fans are white LEDs for anyone who would want to order new fans along with this case.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Pino

customer_reviews.title: The Best Case, PERIOD!
customer_reviews.text: Just beautiful. Came from a black NZXT phantom and just cant believe how nice this case is. It's so much more roomier and cleaner than other styles. Cable mgmt is so nice as well as the HDD and SDD slots. The fasters for the ATX mobo were already screwed on. The black and white combo looks so clean. Bought a new Noctua UH14s which fits perfectly. Keeps my 4.4 OC i5 nice and cool.
customer_reviews.author: aponor

customer_reviews.title: ... while before I bought it although most reviewers weren't overjoyed by the case I love it Main area is ...
customer_reviews.text: This case was on my wishlist for a while before I bought it although most reviewers weren't overjoyed by the case I love it Main area is easy to keep clear for air flow which keeps case temps within reason without liquid cooling components . Only three case fans so noise is greatly reduces over previous case which was an Antec 1200 which had six installed with two more added it was so loud it sounded like a vacuum cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hoey

customer_reviews.title: Huge case with lots of room to work in.
customer_reviews.text: First off this case is HUGE! I didn't expect it to be this big but I am very glad it is. It made cable management in the case very easy and I have easy access to the HD and disc based drives without bending cables and unplugging things on the MB in order to access them. This case because of its size made it very easy to install all the parts. My only complaints are the plastic parts seem kinda cheesy and cheap. My old 5 year old $40 case seems sturdier than this case does.
customer_reviews.author: I DRM Free

customer_reviews.title: This is the best.case.ever!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my Antec P182 with the Air 540, and I am the happiest consumer ever. This case performs as expected, cooling far superior to my old Antec, noise is almost silent (installed Noctua fans, but kept the stock 140s), and it looks amazing, pictures do not do it justice. LED fans are a bit bright, as are the power and hdd LEDs, and the case could have a little bit thicker structure for the upper mounts. On this last point, I used the included screws to mount the two stock 140mm LED fans, and the case rattled a little bit. However I replaced the screws with rubber mounts on the fans and the rattling ceased. Overall an excellent case!
customer_reviews.author: EDominguez

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best cases i've ever worked with
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best cases i've ever worked with, The airflow is phenomenal. The separation of parts makes cable management easy. Looks amazing. My only complaint is the 5inch drive bays sit sideways so putting a lcd fan controller on will look silly :(
customer_reviews.author: SiliconValleyTechLife

customer_reviews.title: Best case i ever had
customer_reviews.text: Best case i ever had. Used in my custom build.Great cable management and airflow. I custom painted the case all white.
customer_reviews.author: Radbanshee

customer_reviews.title: i love this case i really wanted the white one but ...
customer_reviews.text: i love this case i really wanted the white one but this one popped up on sale at just the right time so i snagged it up. i love that all the ugly stuff is kept hidden away from sight like all those ugly wires im not much on wire routing dont have the will to run all thoes wire and make them look neat so this was the perfect case for me and ended up fitting very well with my color scheme. so if you lazy like me about making stuff look neat and tidy this is the case for you.!!!!
customer_reviews.author: christopher dean

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Best case for the Price out there.. as far as a MidRange Box Case.... u can fit any build in it!!! and yes its smaler than a full tower case
customer_reviews.author: Swiss

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic case. Building a computer in this was a ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic case. Building a computer in this was a breeze. The cable management kept everything tidy. The open motherboard backing allows you to mount a cpu cooler without doing a cardboard box build first. It keeps everything cool without sounding like a wind tunnel. Cons: Had to place my 3rd hard drive in the back 5.25" bay. I knew this going in but wish they had an additional/optional cage for an expanded hdd drives in the back. Only 2 front usb (3.0) ports. Doesn't come with top fans.
customer_reviews.author: Arm Flailing Tube Man

customer_reviews.title: Brilliance if you have the space to sit the tower.
customer_reviews.text: I'm never using another style of case again. This thing is perfect for cooling and display. The wires are all hidden perfectly through the rubberized holes and there's plenty of room to work. My favorite was the hard drive bays in the chip side...you mount the drives to the brackets and then just slide them into place and wires in the opposite chamber are where the hookups are made...nothing mobo side.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy L

customer_reviews.title: Love this case
customer_reviews.text: Love this case! Its absolutely amazing for cable management. With all the space on the inside of this case, I was able to fit my MSI Core Frozr L CPU cooler with lots of room to spare. The dust filter for the fans on the front is amazing as well as the additional slots for more fans located at the top of the case. Even though this case is fairly large, it is definitely worth it if you're looking for a case that provides excellent cable management, airflow, and overall easy installation of parts.
customer_reviews.author: Cami

customer_reviews.title: did not seem like usual corsair quality
customer_reviews.text: problems fitting a corsair AX860i, did not seem like usual corsair quality. mine had scuffed and scratched finish in a couple very small areas. sent it back and got an inverse 600C which turned out to be flawless and typical Corsair style and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this case. A little on the big side with its 16 x 18 x 13 dimensions, but very nice looking. Looks way better than any mid tower case and has lots of room for expansion and plenty of air flow. If you have the room, you will not be disappointed with this case.
customer_reviews.author: PvtLarry

customer_reviews.title: Overall great case
customer_reviews.text: This case makes it easy to have a beautiful build in a home PC. I will say that this case is enormous, and was even wider than I expected it to be but looking back that is not a bad thing as it ensures that you have plenty of room for all of your components. I would make this purchase again in a heart beat. The only real downside I have found with this case is the lack of filter for the top fans and the bottom of the case being open.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Conrad

customer_reviews.title: I really like this.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good case. I went with an extra large heatsink and while my buddy had trouble fitting his, I certainly did not. I also forgot to attach the heatsink before attaching the motherboard to the case, but the case provides access to the back of the motherboard :). The cable management is great, I built the computer myself but it looks very professional. This is a big case with a lot of air flow, I enjoy the look too. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff the aeroETop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Case
customer_reviews.text: I love this case! The duel bays separating your power supply and hard drives from your motherboard and graphics card and other heat generating components works and I'm surprised I couldn't find other manufacturers using this design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The last case you'll need for a long time.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice case for the money. Plenty of room for just about any configuration out there. The power supply and cables mount behind the the motherboard so cable management is a breeze. The build quality is solid and the overall layout is simple yet effective. The only caveat is be sure you have the room for this case. It's about the same height as your average mid-tower case but it's near twice the width. I don't call it "The Mini-Fridge" for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: MPearson

customer_reviews.title: Great Case
customer_reviews.text: I looked and looked for a case and found this one it is not a normal case in anyway but i love the wide short look. Wish it had a few more 3.5 bays but it is all good. A few people have said fans were loud but i think for the most part not too bad better then my old case. Cable management is great in this case with out even trying you can be a pro at cable management.
customer_reviews.author: THamilton

customer_reviews.title: REALLLYYYYY LIKE this case
customer_reviews.text: REALLLYYYYY LIKE this case! fantastic airflow, great design with the 2 sides, 1 side for power supply and SSD bays which can be added or removed depending on your preference. The side without the see through panel allows for almost of all of your wires to be hidden and makes for a purty lookin rig. PLENTY of room, I have the biggest Noctua heat-sink known to man and it fits perfectly along with my giant R9 graphics card. Amazing higher-end case.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Best case I have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this case! It's got plenty of room for great custom builds including support for two separate liquid cooling units (one on top, one at the bottom). I run 2 NVidia 970GTX GPU's paired with a liquid cooled I7 and 4 SSD's, the latter are neatly hidden in the right hand side of the case. No heat issues whatsoever and plenty of room to work on the setup when installing/replacing hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H

customer_reviews.title: Great case, lots of airflow, looks very slick
customer_reviews.text: Bought this case a few days ago and I like the more box like shape as opposed to the standard taller tower shape. I almost went with the white color but the silver looks pretty nice and am happy with it, also the silver was a few dollars cheaper. Pros: -Great Airflow like it says and quiet. -Silver case with the white LED on the fans looks really cool -Window to view inside (on the left side of the case) -Easy to open and close with 2 thumb screws holding each panel (top and sides) -Great cable management Cons: -Maybe a little Big for some people
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Best case I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Love this case! Keeps the cool side cool. With the equipment I have in it, I can't even hear this case powered on. It is wider than most PC cases, but there are 2 sides, a very cool side and a ventilated side (for components that do not require a bunch of cooling, but produce heat). If you are going to overclock, this is your case. Supports water cooling apparatuses.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: but I recommend test fitting your parts before completing the whole build ...
customer_reviews.text: Motherboard screws were offset MAYBE 1/8 of an inch, causing my graphics card to fit wonky against the rear. Doesn't hurt anything and the connections can still be put in, so it doesn't bother me, but I recommend test fitting your parts before completing the whole build and realizing it then. Looks awesome though, the pictures on the product page don't really do it justice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful large case that worked out very nice for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful large case that worked out very nice for my first homemade pc build. Supports EATX boards and tons of customization and room for harddrives or solid state drives. Ventilation is adjusted to come in filtered through my liquid cooler through the front, and up out the top. Ventilation spots are mostly necessary in front and top, and slightly in the back, other than that it can be closed off at the sides with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Danny M.

customer_reviews.title: In case you're wondering
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first about the dimensions of this case but once i got to building i fell in love with it. I can't imagine going back to the conventional style of case i have always used. Love this so much. The wide low profile works so well with the room.
customer_reviews.author: satisfied reader

customer_reviews.title: great case!
customer_reviews.text: Its a little small for a push pull configuration and a larger GPU I got a gtx 1070 and didn't have enough clearance to use both fans but still a great case.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J Potts

customer_reviews.title: Top end case with amazing airflow and allows for 3-way sli..and still a ton of room
customer_reviews.text: Making this short and sweet, they use the best materials available from the wires to the case. Superior airflow, and I have 3 gtx 970's, yep triple sli and there's a ton of room for everything...what i love best though is the placement of the PSU, very well done, the engineering put into this case deserves 5 stars...hope this helps,, peace.
customer_reviews.author: Usernameunknown

customer_reviews.title: Nicely designed case
customer_reviews.text: I have limited space for my new computer, and most of the midATX cases I looked at were too big for my taste. Luckily, I came across this case before I had to succumb to getting a miniATX case. The dual chamber design allows for a very clean rig to be set up, and the twin 140 fans in the front provide more than enough airflow for the main components in the computer. I went ahead and got a closed-loop watercooler for my CPU, and the top had plenty of room for a dual length 240 radiator. Corsair hits the mark with this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Jones

customer_reviews.title: Superior than the 350D
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 350D last October. It was recommended to me on an online forum and I thought I would be pleased with it. I was not, however. Then I saw the 540 Air. This thing is AWESOME! It has all the space I need for my supply of SSD's and HDD's. It has plenty of room for my SLI setup and full ATX mobo. This is for someone that wants to build a powerhouse. I love it and the silver color looks slick.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful case. I like the black and white one ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful case. I like the black and white one alot more than the other variations. Looks cleaner and more sleek in my opinion. Also I love stormtroopers. Would give this 5 stars if the window was made from a better material or if corsair offered a upgraded replacement panel. Might mod it to have tempered glass.
customer_reviews.author: OG Pluto

customer_reviews.title: This case is far better than anything else I ever worked with
customer_reviews.text: I have been building PC's for 20 years now (holy s***.. I am old). This case is far better than anything else I ever worked with. Now that I can hide my PSU, I see other people's builds and cringe at the site of the PSU taking up so much space. Cable management is cake. Get the cleanest looking build ever with this case!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: I have a crush on my case
customer_reviews.text: Bought the demciflex filters for it and I couldn't be happier 2 cats and dog and it keeps clean with regular maintenance, super easy to work in and looks good to boot
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Unique and great value
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful case with tons of space. PSU and storage drives along with the bulk of your wires can be hidden in the right chassis giving you a clean look and it makes cable management a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Almquist

customer_reviews.title: ... smaller mini atx version of this case earlier and loved the cable management and how it moves the psu ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the smaller mini atx version of this case earlier and loved the cable management and how it moves the psu to a different part of the case. It is honestly my favorite design in terms of practicality and the case fans are very quiet to boot.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Letcher

customer_reviews.title: Love this case
customer_reviews.text: Love this case. Worth every cent. Best case I have ever had. Only problem is I wish it had more slots for older hard drives. If you have alot of SSD drives it's great but if you have the old type of hard drives it's not. But other then that it's a great case.
customer_reviews.author: Pieman16

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomically Smart Design
customer_reviews.text: Spent a week deciding on a case for a new PC build. In a last minute split decision I went with this Corsair Carbide. Beautiful and ergonomical, BIG, but looks smaller than Antec P180 it replaced. Truly a showpiece... catches and impresses all who have seen it to including my wife who is a designer. You will love the room and smart compartmentalization features. Very fast and easy to build in.It took more time to remove mobo/CPU, 3 Hardisks, and DVD drive from old P180 than it took to build from ground up (including 3 additional NIB components) within the Corsair. Cons: none I've noticed.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great medium-priced cast for somebody who needs a little shorter ...
customer_reviews.text: Great medium-priced cast for somebody who needs a little shorter filled with hot air flow and great cable management as others have mentioned and multiple YouTube videos great case for gaming or high performance system somewhat limited on hard drives but would cover almost any standard build for a great price
customer_reviews.author: Highspeedplay

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: The Air 540 was a dream to work in. Plenty of cable management options and the dual chamber design is genius. I love how I was able to achieve an almost "Cableless" look with this case. The white is gloss and looks amazing in person! The hotswap drives on the bottom in the panel side of the case is an awesome extra and really adds to the aesthetics of the overall case. The SSD cages in the other chamber are nice and I like them being stored there. No complaints. Not as bad as everyone made it out to be! Overall rock solid case and I love it! Would highly recommend to anyone interested!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great looking case
customer_reviews.text: Great looking case, but feels a bit flimsy. The hot swap hard drives are a great addition, but its location to the case frame makes it sound like my hard drives are clicking when in use. Spent 2 weeks thinking my hard drive was going bad until I realized it made the sound to every hard drive I inserted in there.
customer_reviews.author: Kyosji Kenji

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic case - Nothing negative to say
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I want to write many paragraphs about this case, but honestly I can sum it up in one word: "Excellent". I've owned many cases in my life, but this is easily the best one.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Veey roomy pc case for enthusiasts!!! Love this case!!!
customer_reviews.text: When I built my first PC, I purchased this case in black. The case is a dream to work in. Its very roomy, and it has excellent cable management room. The case is divided into 2 almost equal chambers. One for the motherboard and components you will want to show off thru the huge side panel window, and the other side is for the components you really don't care to see, like the power supply, hard drives and wires/cables. I bought my 2nd case in the white mode for my 2nd build and I love the way it looks. Have big plans for customizing the look (which is what this case is all about). Highly recommend this case!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: BIG CASE
customer_reviews.text: Yes all caps, the case is big, saw the review on cnet or newegg and liked the design. It does look big on the review but measured it out and said, ehh that aint bad... but yes it is big. I am not second guessing my decision because I love it. The fans are super quiet, lots of room, no complaints from this buyer.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Most well thought out case
customer_reviews.text: This case is lovely, with a place for everything. Its large, but extremely well thought out. This is perfect for someone who wants to tuck away all those cables and display the computers components. Its separated into two sections. You hook everything up on one side and tuck all the cables and wires to the other side into discrete holes so they're out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Justin & Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful and plenty of room. Purchase a black one and a white one for two threadripper builds. Doesn’t get any better. I puchesed the largest heat sinks and it fit in there fine.
customer_reviews.author: Brad ray

customer_reviews.title: One of the easiest computer builds ive ever done
customer_reviews.text: I opted to go with this one over the INWIN 909. Yea i know they are like $300 different in price but it was worth it because this case looks sleek and makes cable management look super easy. It doesn't have a dust filter which is really the only thing that sucks about this case. Other than that I cant think of a singe reason why anyone Shouldn't get this case!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: and great cable management
customer_reviews.text: Well built, and great cable management. The extra space and larger fans have helped keep my components cooler than they have ever been. I have not used the hot swap bays, so I cannot comment on their quality, but the rest of the case is magnificent. I would purchase all over again given a second chance.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Brannon

customer_reviews.title: BIG
customer_reviews.text: This case is HUGE, and it allows for stupidly easy cable management. My CPU temp with the stock cooler was at 43 degrees C. This is with a HOT FX-8350. It also kept my stupidly hot r9 390 asus strix at a cool 54 C. Awesome case and have no complaints other than the optical drive cage is kind of annoying to remove, you have to remove the front panels on both sides. As well as i would like to see a fan filter for the top two 140 mm fans. Other than those two complaints awesome build quality. And superior chamber cooling design.
customer_reviews.author: Colton

customer_reviews.title: Overall this a good and spacefull case
customer_reviews.text: Overall this a good and spacefull case, but some of the parts feel rather cheap. Specifically, the ssd platic module (for ssd installation) and the hdd/ssd hot swap holders. One of the 4 containers of the ssd module broke after I tryed to put it apart in order to reduce space. As this was one of my first experiences with the case while doing my build up, it was kind of dissapointing. But as I said before, this is overall a good and spacefull case.
customer_reviews.author: ivanalejandro88

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love with this case
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with this case. I used it for my first ever PC build (high performance gaming) and it made assembly a breeze. I love the back compartment that stores all the cables and makes the main chamber so clean and beautiful to look at. The airflow is insane, especially after I bought two additional case fans for the roof.
customer_reviews.author: Dan (personal acct)

customer_reviews.title: Everything stays nice and cool
customer_reviews.text: Everything stays nice and cool. It's really easy to install everything, the tool less drives are cool. Only small annoyance is the top cooling grill rattles a little sometimes, either when i bump the desk or when the fans are blowing on it. Other then that it's a great case.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Maximum Airflow
customer_reviews.text: Great case overall. Room for anything you'd like, fantastic cable management options. A joy to build in. Only complaint are the weird wobbly 2.5" drive mounts
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: best cpu I've had
customer_reviews.text: This case makes installing your own computer dummy proof. Cable management is superb and it looks pretty sleek. The best thing are the fans. They cool things pretty well and you wont hear a thing. Really. I've left it on many nights because I don't even notice it is on, no noice at all. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love this color. Couldn't find it anywhere else. Works well for my X99 build. I put 2 80mm fans above the ssd bays for better airflow on the rea side of case. I also replaced the stock fans with Thermaltake HALO led fans.
customer_reviews.author: SpeedingCheetah

customer_reviews.title: Cable f'n Managment baby.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for ease of cable management and better heat regulation. Does both well.
customer_reviews.author: MyFi

customer_reviews.title: Case is pretty amazing. Would have given it a 5 star ...
customer_reviews.text: Case is pretty amazing. Would have given it a 5 star except that there are a few things that bug me; like the 3.5" drive positions and 5.25" carriage blocks a bit of the cable openings. Other than those minor things it's pretty great.
customer_reviews.author: Grady

customer_reviews.title: The case was super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was my first build. The case was super easy to use, and I ended up with a clean layout and no messy wires. It's not a super large case so you wont feel like your internal components are dwarfed by the case. The case is also not too small to fit large GPU's inside of it. Cable management was a breeze. I'd recommend this case for anyone who still needs an optical drive, but doesn't want to an overly large case taking up a lot of desk/floor space.
customer_reviews.author: rob c

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous Monolith
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely gorgeous case. Holds my Z170 A board and nearly any fan configuration I can imagine. Bottom hard drive bays are open to the air without filtration so a fan config that makes the inside pressure higher is very important (more fans blowing in than out).
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: If you're not used to these types of cases, it's going to seem awkwardly wide (compared to the pictures you see online), but you get used to it. It's great for my OCD when it comes to not seeing wires since you can slop the crap out of the back side with all the wires and you won't notice a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Nahas

customer_reviews.title: Really like this case!
customer_reviews.text: Great case with LOTS of room. I love the power supply and cables are hidden behind the motherboard and the drives are there as well. Makes my case look very clean!
customer_reviews.author: Charles B.

customer_reviews.title: I'm extremely happy with it
customer_reviews.text: It's a boxy, weird shape. It takes a lot of floor space (I don't mind). If you're OK with that, and you want the cleanest looking window possible, this is your case. I'm extremely happy with it. The HDD/SSD docks at the bottom are slick and the cable management is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Jace Priester

customer_reviews.title: This case is awesome because it's like a Mini Fridge for your PC
customer_reviews.text: This case is awesome because it's like a Mini Fridge for your PC! Not because it looks like a mini fridge(which I think is awesome) but so many slots for fans. *ahem* buy some noctuas, though *ahem* This my first ever build and I was trying to build a PC that looks like I know what I'm doing and something I could just stare at and appreciate. This case made it so easy to achieve what I was after. Remember! It's a big case!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Simone

customer_reviews.title: Solid Case Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I love this case. I maybe I'll write a more detailed review later but in summary this is a good product. The case has excellent cord management ; it keeps things running cool; plenty of space to build without squeezing your hands; and runs quite. Aesthetically it is good to look at and not too big but I'll be honest it takes space. Overall solid case I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JJTP

customer_reviews.title: Best Build Ever.
customer_reviews.text: Spacious and well-built. Also keeps my computer running cool all day with the ventilation technology where I had set up the default 2 x 140mm fans for intake, 2 x SP120mm and H80i w/SP120 (push/pull design). Plenty of room behind for all your wiring, SSDs, and PSU.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: tons of space, dual chambers makes you think this ...
customer_reviews.text: tons of space, dual chambers makes you think this should be standard on all cases. Works well with the Corsair AIO water coolers. Somewhat noisy fans, but if you are buying this case you are probably looking to customize them anyways.
customer_reviews.author: asilva54

customer_reviews.title: Higher price = Higher amplification of small problems
customer_reviews.text: Love the case, but after mounting and installing everything I realized the case didn't sit evenly. I had to prop up and balance the case. I expect better from a premium case with a premium price. The only reason I'm not exchanging/refunding is because I don't want to wait any longer to use my pc.
customer_reviews.author: Gtx Stryker

customer_reviews.title: Building my first computer.
customer_reviews.text: I'd have to say for being my first computer that I'm going to build this case is awesome. (Yes I'm a n00b) It's so much bigger than I thought it would be. I love that. I'd reccomend it to anyone :) Very nice case. Let's get this thing going.. \o/
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: This case design makes for an awesome PC build!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome case that has a lot of room for many types of builds, especially watercooling like I did with my GTX 1080 SLI build! The PSU sits on another side of the wall in the case that has plenty of room for cable management and keeps the windowed area clean and clutter free. The whole case besides the PSU panel is made of plastic but it's not one of those cheaply made plastics either. I highly recommend this to anyone that's looking for a case that looks great plus providing plenty of room for all types of builds at a decent price!
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Encarnacion

customer_reviews.title: Nothing short of awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome awesome awesome case, it is built for a super easy installation in a small case. Cable management was THE EASIEST I have ever had before in a PC build. I would highly recommend this case to anybody who is looking to do a build in a very accomodating but small case. The design is beautiful, the features are perfect, and for a consumer grade gaming or basic use computer it is just the product to pick up!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Best case I've ever owned, great cable managment and cooling.
customer_reviews.text: Great case, lots of room for really good airflow. Comes with 3 fans, power supply installs on back side and grommets allow for amazing cable management. Great for mounting corsair liquid coolers.
customer_reviews.author: Infidex

customer_reviews.title: Easy to build a rig with this case
customer_reviews.text: Bought case for new gaming rig. Love the two compartments which make cable management much easier than previous cases I have used. Easy case to install liquid cooling. Well built except for the hdd and ssd holders. I wish the holders for the optical drive were horizontal rather than vertical. All in all very pleased with the case, just know it is almost as wide as tall so you need to account for that in placement.
customer_reviews.author: Surfer mom

customer_reviews.title: I love this case and it keeps all my components cooler ...
customer_reviews.text: You can read in-depth reviews of this case elsewhere, I love this case and it keeps all my components cooler than any other case i've had before. And it looks amazing on top of everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Pat W.

customer_reviews.title: The best computer case I've ever owned hands down
customer_reviews.text: The best computer case I've ever owned hands down. I'm not sure I'll ever need a new one. Lots of room to work in, makes it easy to have a nice and clean build.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Case is great, I love that you can put the cabling ...
customer_reviews.text: Case is great, I love that you can put the cabling in one side and the hardware in the other, gives it a nice clean look.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua B.

customer_reviews.title: It is truely amazing! I love it
customer_reviews.text: It is the Ultimate Upgrade from the regular mid-towers.. It is truely amazing! I love it. It alows continuous airflow throughout the entire cube. Highly recommended every Pc owner to aquire this Rig.. Speachless
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Looks expensive, but isn't.  Great design.  Now wishing for an Obsidian-series version of this case.
customer_reviews.text: The silver edition of this case really sets off any build. The LED fans included are part of the AF140 LED series and are of high quality. Plenty of room to work in and the split zone setup is a godsend for cable management. It's sized just-right for my build.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hoesel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case.
customer_reviews.text: Best case i ever owned. I was able to fit two asus gtx 908 ti matrix plat cards. surprisingly good air flow since i only have the two intake front fans and radiator on top.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

product_meta.title: Corsair CC-9011048-WW Carbide Series Air 540 Windowed ATX High Airflow Cube Performance Computer Case with White LED Fan - Arctic White
feature_bullets: Dual-chamber Direct Airflow Path design for outstanding cooling potential
Clever, space-saving design still offers lots of internal volume
Includes three High Performance Air Series AF140L fans for better, quieter cooling
Tons of expansion room for high performance air cooling and liquid cooling
Full side panel window Cable routing cutouts with rubber grommets Front dust filter

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars677 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
